programme.title: The 12 Disasters of Christmas
programme.desc: On Christmas eve, an enormous dark star appears in the sky. Could this star signify that Judgement Day is approaching? When natural disasters begin to occur, a small band of heroes must team up and try to save the world.

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Standing at the Anglo-Scots border, Carlisle Castle has a long and brutal history of battles, takeovers and hauntings. A soldier reportedly died of fright there after he saw the ghost of a woman who was once buried inside the castle walls. What will the team find?

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Yvette and the `Most Haunted crew visit Brinkburn Priory in Rothbury, a 12th century building, which is said to be haunted by the spirits of the monks who lived and died there.

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Yvette and the team hold a vigil at Maesmawr Hall, in the Welsh village of Caersws. The spirit of a white horse has been sighted in nearby fields where an old Roman road used to lie, and some have reported seeing Roman legionnaires walking about at night.

programme.title: Most Haunted
programme.desc: Yvette and the `Most Haunted team visit Belsay Hall in Morpeth, Northumberland, a decaying 19th century mansion where the voices of long-dead children ring in the air.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Crossing the Solent with a ticket to Ryde, Michael boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton. His destination is Osborne House, where the future King Edward VII spent much of his childhood.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo promises to do his best on the island where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of modern scouts he learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys and girls today.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a railway adventure from the coalfields of South Wales around the Bristol Channel to the southernmost tip of Cornwall. His first stop is Whitland in Carmarthenshire, where in the early 20th century, thrill-seekers gathered on Pendine Sands to indulge their need for speed. Michael joins latter day petrol heads to burn rubber on the beach in an iconic 3 wheeler.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael strikes gold at the Royal Mint in Llantrisant where after much frisking, he gains access to the inner vaults. At Cardiff Arms Park, Michael revisits the scene of a triumphant Welsh victory over the fearsome All Blacks and hears from Welsh international, Gerald Davies, how the Welsh national anthem kicked the intimidating Haka into touch.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to acquire some vintage motorcycles from a collection in a garage at the bottom of a garden in the North East. Meanwhile, Paul tries to bag a 1955 Ford Zephyr convertible.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Meanwhile, Derek has his work cut out in Yorkshire trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting a precarious garage roof.

programme.title: Rise of the Nazis
programme.desc: In 1930 Germany was a liberal democracy, with elections, parliament and the rule of law. Just four years later, democracy is dead, Germanys leader is a dictator and its government is in the hands of murderers. This is the story of how this happened.

programme.title: Adolf Hitlers War
programme.desc: In Kursk, a `battlefield the size of Wales, the tide turns, and the Soviets push back, but as Germany retreats, they destroy all evidence of their genocidal activities.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The `Antiques Roadshow makes a return visit to Belton House in Lincolnshire where treasures include a ceramic model of London Zoos first elephant, a 400 year old Japanese chest and a walnut with a secret.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.desc: Simon rejoins the Tropic in Egypt and follows it through Saudi Arabia, Dubai, and Oman. In Southern Egypt, next to the ancient temple of Abu Simbal, Simon meets Nubians struggling to maintain their culture following the damming of the Nile and dives in the pristine reefs of the Red Sea.

programme.title: Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: A journey around the edge of the Indian Ocean with Simon Reeve. This first leg takes him from the rugged coast of South Africa, where he joins the fight against wildlife poachers, through Mozambique, and on to the tropical island of Zanzibar. On the way, he swims with sharks, meets refugees, and travels on a huge container ship fortified against the constant threat of pirates.

programme.title: Russia with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Setting out amongst the snow-capped volcanoes of Kamchatka, over 4,000 miles from Moscow, Simon explores one of the remotest regions of the country. He finds indigenous reindeer herders who are still eking out a fragile existence.
